title: (x) South American Newspaper headline - Jaeger Daily News {Mike Y}
content:
Ok! Here's another challenge, since I couldn't find the name of this font...   
   
 ![South Amercian newspaper headline font](http://web.archive.org/web/20050525002016im_/http:/www.typophile.com/forums/messages/83/41019.jpg)   
   
This font is used on the headlines of a south american newspaper...   
Does anybody know the name of that font?   
   
Thanks!!!
author: JuanMa

comments.content: I think it's Jaeger Daily News from Berthold

Here's a link to the [Berthold](http://web.archive.org/web/20050525002016/http:/www.bertholdtypes.com/adobe_lib/080332000.html) showing.   
   
At [Phil's Fonts](http://web.archive.org/web/20050525002016/http:/www.philsfonts.com/showing.html?sku=BQ900680X1P1&start=1) you can see the whole alphabet.

Clever Mike...   
   
I'd been browsing through the berthold site but I didn't catch it.   
   
jmc \_=+

Not clever, just persistent. I thought the 'a' and 'f' looked familiar, so I started scanning the Font Book serif font pages for the 'a' letter, starting with Z fonts and working forward (coming from the end of the alphabet myself, I like to start there).   
   
If I had started with the A font names, I would have found it sooner.

hmmm... Why not clever?   
   
Persistence is a quality of clever people. Don't be so modest.   
   
: )
